text: I was curious as to how NeuralPDE.jl calculated higher order derivatives, so I had a peek. Does it use numeric gradients (<https://github.com/SciML/NeuralPDE.jl/blob/c93e05192d4023f5eaa8bff566b739d090a9816a/src/pinns_pde_solve.jl#L483|GitHub link>)? Tensorflow/PyTorch implementations of PINNs tend to use AD, I think? I was curious of the pros and cons of either approach. I thought the ability to AD all the things was part of the appeal of PINNS, though I'm probably missing something---I'm not so savvy with understanding the implications of AD and higher order derivatives.
